notable_quotes.speaker: Mongeon Bourald (dying man)
notable_quotes.french: que c'estoient toutes genaxes qui estoient alentour de luy
notable_quotes.context: During his illness, said witches were all around him

notable_quotes.speaker: Mongeatte
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle estoit peu fine, qu'elle ne pouvoit se venger a cause qu'elle ne pensoit aux affaires, mesme qu'elle estoit bien nette
notable_quotes.context: When asked why she did not seek legal reparation for being called witch

notable_quotes.speaker: Mongeatte
notable_quotes.french: Mongeatte voila ung devin au logis dudit Bourald, lequel dict que demain la premiere femme qui entrera du matin en chez eulx que que c'est celle que luy at eu donné sa maladie
notable_quotes.context: Husband told her what the devin said about first woman to enter house

notable_quotes.speaker: Mongeatte (explaining toad ritual)
notable_quotes.french: bestes je te leve au nom du pere et du fils et du St esprit
notable_quotes.context: Prayer said when picking up toads for veterinary purposes

notable_quotes.speaker: Jean Huat (vagabond healer)
notable_quotes.french: et que le venin et poison attire l'autre
notable_quotes.context: Teaching her about using toads to draw out parasites/poison from animals

notable_quotes.speaker: Jean Huat
notable_quotes.french: aussy tost la poison attire l'autre et regarder combien il vindroit
notable_quotes.context: Instructions for hanging toad under animals

notable_quotes.speaker: Idoult Jean Martin (witness)
notable_quotes.french: presume qu'elle estoit empeschée de l'ennemy sy elle est telle
notable_quotes.context: About the host incident at Easter - presumed she was impeded by the devil if she was a witch

economic_context.details: Dispute over payment of accused's son for looking after village animals. Dispute over land sale by husband to his brother (accused was angry). Accused was village midwife and healer for animals. Her role as keeper of village animals on rotation created multiple conflicts.

material_culture.context: Used to draw parasites/vermin from animals; hung beneath animals for 5 days or more
Found in field, she said contained holy water
Behind fireplace for protection from fire
Behind fireplace for protection from fire
Behind fireplace for protection from fire
Behind fireplace for protection from fire
Placed in field at Easter to prevent vermin attacking crops
Found in field containing water, small candles, 'des pampies et du jolis bois'
Given as money by devil Parsin (confessed under torture)
Black powder to harm men and animals; white powder to heal (confessed under torture)
Pact to give devil black hen every year to be exempt from sabbat
Eaten at sabbat with white or black bread
Given by priest when she had difficulty taking host
Had difficulties taking at Easter communion

spatial_references.context: Primary location of trial and residence of accused
Where accused went at night to brother-in-law's house; where some accomplices lived
Location of church where host incident occurred; residence of prior and some witnesses
Suburb of Raon where accomplice lived
Where animals were kept; where bottles and pots with magical items were found

historical_context.military_details: Soldiers threw away the toads 2 years earlier; Jean Chapelle assigned a horse she had kept back to the soldiers

legal_context.redress_outcome: She said she was 'peu fine' (not clever), could not take revenge because she did not think about such affairs, and that she was innocent

change_de_nancy.modification_details: Approved torture with moderation suitable to her age; approved death sentence subject to reaffirmation of confessions without threat of torture

hearsay_chains.content: When husband sold property to his brother she was very angry, went alone at night to their house at Raon
Accused was cause of husband's death, 2 devins identified her
How witches attacked babies in cradles and dug up bodies to make powder

emotional_state_notes: continued to deny all charges during confrontations

third_parties.context: Bought land from husband; accused was very angry about this sale

third_parties.name: widow of Mongeon Bourald
third_parties.context: Said accused was cause of husband's death

extraction_metadata.notes: Trial shows extensive witness testimony about veterinary healing practices with toads; accused was village midwife and healer. Multiple animal deaths over 6-7 year period. Central incident involves devin (cunning person) identifying accused as cause of neighbor's death. Confession obtained under torture (thumbscrews). Change de Nancy consulted twice - approved torture with age-appropriate moderation, then approved death sentence conditional on reaffirmation without torture threat. Executed after reaffirming confessions.
